00001 /**
00002  * \file RandomPower2.hpp
00003  * \brief Header for RandomPower2.
00004  *
00005  * Return and multiply by powers of two.
00006  *
00007  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2006-2011) <charles@karney.com> and licensed
00008  * under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00009  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00010  **********************************************************************/
00011 
00012 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_RANDOMPOWER2_HPP)
00013 #define RANDOMLIB_RANDOMPOWER2_HPP \
00014   "$Id: 7e91d02ba364b811c79a9932e1a6986985bc9601 $"
00015 
00016 #include <cmath>                // For std::pow
00017 
00018 namespace RandomLib {
00019 
00020   /**
00021    * \brief Return or multiply by powers of 2
00022    *
00023    * With some compilers it's fastest to do a table lookup of powers of
00024    * 2.  If RANDOMLIB_POWERTABLE is 1, a lookup table is used.  If
00025    * RANDOMLIB_POWERTABLE is 0, then std::pow is used.
00026    **********************************************************************/
00027   class RANDOM_EXPORT RandomPower2 {
00028   public:
00029     /**
00030      * Return powers of 2 (either using a lookup table or std::pow)
00031      *
00032      * @param[in] n the integer power.
00033      * @return 2<sup><i>n</i></sup>.
00034      **********************************************************************/
00035     template<typename RealType> static inline RealType pow2(int n) throw() {
00036 #if RANDOMLIB_POWERTABLE
00037       return RealType(power2[n - minpow]);
00038 #else
00039       return std::pow(RealType(2), n);
00040 #endif
00041     }
00042     /**
00043      * Multiply a real by a power of 2
00044      *
00045      * @tparam RealType the type of \e x.
00046      * @param[in] x the real number.
00047      * @param[in] n the power (positive or negative).
00048      * @return \e x 2<sup><i>n</i></sup>.
00049      **********************************************************************/
00050     template<typename RealType>
00051     static inline RealType shiftf(RealType x, int n) throw()
00052     // std::ldexp(x, n); is equivalent, but slower
00053     { return x * pow2<RealType>(n); }
00054 
00055     // Constants
00056     enum {
00057       /**
00058        * Minimum power in RandomPower2::power2
00059        **********************************************************************/
00060 #if RANDOMLIB_LONGDOUBLEPREC > 64
00061       minpow = -120,
00062 #else
00063       minpow = -64,
00064 #endif
00065       maxpow = 64               /**< Maximum power in RandomPower2::power2. */
00066     };
00067   private:
00068 #if RANDOMLIB_POWERTABLE
00069     /**
00070      * Table of powers of two
00071      **********************************************************************/
00072     static const float power2[maxpow - minpow + 1]; // Powers of two
00073 #endif
00074   };
00075 
00076 } // namespace RandomLib
00077 
00078 #endif  // RANDOMLIB_RANDOMPOWER2_HPP
